alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Owsley; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 01 at 4:09PM EST until January 01 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Laurel County in south central Kentucky... Northern Knox County in southeastern Kentucky... Central Owsley County in southeastern Kentucky... Southeastern Jackson County in southeastern Kentucky... North central Whitley County in south central Kentucky... Clay County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 445 PM EST. * At 408 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Victory to Gray, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Cornelius around 415 PM EST. Tyner around 420 PM EST. Nathanton around 425 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Endee, Chestnut Gap and Jacks Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Owsley; Whitley
